examples.text: She was clutching the sheet around her naked body.
The photograph showed a naked man.
He was naked from the waist up.
They often wandered around the house **stark naked** *(= completely naked)*.
They found him **half naked** and bleeding to death.
The prisoners were **stripped naked**.
I suggest you don't make a habit of going around half naked.
He quickly stripped naked.
I dreamt I went to school stark naked.
buck naked
a naked light
a naked sword
Mice are born naked *(= without fur)*.
a naked flame
the sight of a tree, naked of its leaves
naked aggression
Revealed: the naked truth about your favourite soap stars.

definitions.definition: unable to protect yourself from being harmed, criticized, etc.

examples.text: He still felt naked and drained after his ordeal.
Never had he felt so completely naked.

definitions.definition: the normal power of your eyes without the help of an instrument

examples.text: The planet should be visible **with/to the naked eye**.

wordOrigin: Old English nacod, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch naakt and German nackt, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin nudus and Sanskrit nagna.
